image.altText: Police commissioner hugs indigenous woman after apologising for NT police failure

props.synopsis: The NT police commissioner's historic apology at Garma has been cautiously welcomed by Aboriginal peak bodies, but it's deepened the rift between the police union and the executive.

title.children: NT police commissioner's Garma apology hailed as a 'new dawning'

image.altText: Noah Lyles roars with delight while holding up an American flag

props.synopsis: The shortest race, an indeterminable wait, the finest margin of victory. The men's 100m final at the Paris Olympics stretched and bent time into an impossible puzzle that only Noah Lyles could solve.

title.children: The shortest race and the longest of glories â€” how a brash American bent time to claim 100m Olympic gold

image.altText: A city late at night with three streaks of light going up in the air.

props.synopsis: Tensions have been soaring in recent days following the death of Ismail Haniyeh, the leader of Hamas.

title.children: US and its allies race to ease tensions in the Middle East amid more Israeli strikes in Gaza

image.altText: Man in hat buys food at a Foodbank

props.synopsis: Ahead of this month's Northern Territory election, voters worried about the rising cost of living say they feel neither of the major parties have committed enough to tackle the problem.

title.children: 'Eating Weet-Bix breakfast, lunch and dinner': Calls for NT parties to tackle cost of living ahead of election

image.altText: Prime Minister Anthony Albanese speaking into a microphone.

props.synopsis: The government is staring down the barrel of an election by May next year. It does not want to be arguing about Makarrata and treaty because it believes it is a battle it will not win.

title.children: Timidity reigns as Albanese backs away from a promise ahead of the next election

image.altText: Two Australian teammates stand smiling arm in arm with Australian flags after the women's high jump final.

props.synopsis: Nicola Olyslagers wins a second Olympic silver medal in the high jump, with fellow Australian Eleanor Patterson claiming the bronze, as the Aussies shared the podium with their Ukrainian rivals.

title.children: 'The perfect podium': Olyslagers and Patterson pay tribute to Ukrainian rivals in magical night for Aussie high jumpers

image.altText: McCarthy speaks in front of a row of microphones.

props.synopsis: Malarndirri McCarthy, the new minister for Indigenous Australians, says the prime minister's words were misinterpreted and the government has not ditched its promise to implement the Uluru Statement from the Heart in full.

title.children: 'Not what I heard': New Indigenous Australians minister says government has not abandoned Makarrata promise

image.altText: A shot of a busy Melbourne street with pedestrians in front of a tram.

props.synopsis: Expectations the Reserve Bank is likely to keep rates on hold will be of little relief to mortgage holders. Here are the simple, brutal numbers behind why people are hurting.

title.children: These are the simple, brutal numbers that explain why households are doing it tough right now

image.altText: Close-up image of a McDonald's Big Mac burger on light coloured background

props.synopsis: The cost of a Big Mac can help us understand the big picture of what's going on with spiralling prices.

title.children: The price of this burger tells the story of our cost-of-living crisis

image.altText: An exterior photo of Parliament House in Darwin. There are large palm trees out the front.

props.synopsis: As the NT election campaign kicks off, its first week has been marked by big spending promises and criticism of poor consultation over future policy.

title.children: Starter's gun fired on NT election campaign, with big money and policy change promises

image.altText: Pool (1)

props.synopsis: In 2020, three childcare workers took six children on their weekly excursion to the pool â€“ but only five made it home. A five-day inquest has probed how one toddler was left behind at a public swimming pool.

title.children: Alone and locked in a public pool, Kumanjayi drowned in minutes. His family wants answers

image.altText: A man sits at a kitchen table with an open laptop in front of him.

props.synopsis: NT home owners say lax residential building regulations have left them dealing with major structural defects they aren't able to get fixed or claim compensation for. They are calling on both sides of NT politics to commit to changing that.

title.children: Jonathan bought a defective new apartment and then found regulators can't do anything about it

image.altText: A close-up of solar panels on top of a house

props.synopsis: The union, whose former NSW leader is now the assistant industry minister, thinks the department is too "market-based".

title.children: Labor-linked union wants Treasury to keep its nose out of funding for industry

image.altText: An 1800s photo of an old man with a large white moustache

props.synopsis: Rubber is waterproof, durable and in so many everyday items it would be impossible for our world to exist in this form without it. However, like many resources, it has a dark past.

title.children: An Englishman took 70,000 seeds from the Amazon. It changed the world

image.altText: Indigenous women at night time looking at the camera.

props.synopsis: Through the stringybark forest on top of an escarpment in north-east Arnhem Land, the sounds of women crying and howling echo through the trees before a gallery comes alive.

title.children: This is what an art gallery in remote Australia looks like, and it's beautiful

image.altText: A stock trader looks down at a tablet as he works on the floor of a busy stock exchange while surrounded by screens.

props.synopsis: The ASX tumbles 2.3 per cent on opening as global markets react to growing fears of an impending US recession. Follow the day's events and insights from our business reporters on the ABC News live markets blog.

title.children: ASX tumbles 2.3pc on open after recession fears crunch Wall Street and global markets

image.altText: Opals wrap

props.synopsis: The Opals manage to beat France by enough to avoid an early meeting with the USA, the Kookaburras are knocked out, and the Stingers keep on winning. Here's everything you need to know about the Australian teams overnight.

title.children: Opals move on and avoid early meeting with the US, as Kookaburras exit and Stingers win again

image.altText: Nicola Olyslagers lays on her back and reads her journal

props.synopsis: Much of an Olympic high jump final is spent watching and waiting. In very different ways, Nicola Olyslagers and Eleanor Patterson conquered the in-betweens before soaring above the competition.

title.children: Olyslagers and Patterson master the silences to stand together upon the Olympic podium

image.altText: An Australian high jumper smiles widely and pumps her fist after a jump in the high jump final at the Olympics.

props.synopsis: Nicola Olyslagers and Eleanor Patterson have secured silver and bronze for Australia in the high jump, while Noah Lyles has claimed 100m gold by the barest of margins.

title.children: Olyslagers claims silver and Patterson shares bronze in the high jump, as US claims 100m men's gold in dramatic finish

image.altText: A girl with brown hair and wearing a pink sweater walks through a home carrying a cardboard box.

props.synopsis: Six years ago Alison and Amelia moved from the east coast of Australia to Perth to escape homelessness. Now, rising rents out west mean they're facing it again.

title.children: These women moved to Perth after falling homeless on the east coast. Prices caught up with them again

image.altText: Jess Fox

props.synopsis: Jessica Fox says she is "gutted" that she won't get a chance to win a third Paris Olympics medal, but that she was proud little sister Noemie still has a shot.

title.children: 'Gutted' Jess Fox misses shot at third Paris Olympics medal, but sister Noemie is still in the running

image.altText: Portrait of a young man against a blurry neutral background

props.synopsis: A NSW inquiry finds emergency accommodation for vulnerable children is "not suitable" or "appropriate", with many spending more than 600 days in what's meant to be a temporary care arrangement.

title.children: Lachlan is 'haunted' by his experiences while in emergency care. There are calls for the arrangement to 'cease'

image.altText: A portrait of an older man wearing a black beanie and maroon, yellow and green in a room.

props.synopsis: For about 60 years Paul Morgan did not talk about his treatment at a mental hospital in Brisbane. Now he wants others to know his story as part of a push for a truth commission into the facility's practices.

title.children: Former patient at Wolston Park Mental Hospital details his alleged abuse for the first time

image.altText: Adelaide researcher Dr Michael Taylor has found legionella bacteria can live on their own

props.synopsis: Victoria's health authorities confirm two people have died in a legionnaires' disease outbreak in Melbourne and dozens of people are in hospital. A source is yet to be identified.

title.children: Two people confirmed dead in Melbourne's legionnaires' disease outbreak with source still unidentified

image.altText: An anti-immigration protester uses a fire extinguisher on police officers in Rotherham

props.synopsis: Police in the north of England struggle to hold back a group of far-right activists seeking to break into a hotel believed to be housing asylum seekers, as anti-immigration protests continue to erupt around the UK.Â

title.children: Police struggle to hold back far-right rioters from English hotel 'housing asylum seekers'

image.altText: A group of three Olympic medals - with silver, gold and bronze left to right - are shown against a dark background.

props.synopsis: Keep up with how many medals Aussie athletes won on day nine â€” and where Australia sits on the leaderboard.

title.children: Here's the medal standings after day nine of the Olympic Games

image.altText: Australian female hockey players, wearing green and gold uniforms, celebrate as a dejected USA goalkeeper walks past.

props.synopsis: Here's everything that's going to be happening on day 10 of the Olympic Games.

title.children: Olympics schedule day 10: Hockeyroos face China, sailors hit the water and Rose Davies to run for Australia

image.altText: Lady standing in front of red brick single-storey house.

props.synopsis: Kellie Berry's property has flooded multiple times since she moved in 9 years ago, despite her area not being identified as flood-prone. She wants the council to better maintain stormwater drainage to prevent another flooding disaster that forced her out of her home for two years.

title.children: Every time it rains in Melbourne, Kellie fears her family home will flood

image.altText: Man in hat buys food at a Foodbank

props.synopsis: Ahead of this month's Northern Territory election, voters worried about the rising cost of living say they feel neither of the major parties have committed enough to tackle the problem.

title.children: 'Eating Weet-Bix breakfast, lunch and dinner': Calls for NT parties to tackle cost of living ahead of election

image.altText: Two men sit at a press conference table with blue microphones in front of them

props.synopsis: Andrei Pivovarov and Ilya Yashin, who were freed from prison as part of the major East-West prisoner swap, say they are already thinking about returning to Russia to continue their activism.Â

title.children: Two Russian dissident prisoners freed in major swap want to return home

image.altText: Police gather in the middle of a road as smoke is rising from objects burning on the ground.

props.synopsis: Nearly 100 people are dead and the government is imposing a nationwide curfew after protesters calling for the country's prime minister to resign clashed with police.

title.children: Protests in Bangladesh turn deadly amid calls for prime minister to resign

image.altText: A man looks into the camera as police run behind him.

props.synopsis: Trap stars former teen heart-throb Josh Hartnett who's trying to give his tween daughter the night of her life and evade police at the same time.

title.children: M Night Shyamalan's Trap asks: What if a serial killer was caught up in a stadium pop concert?

image.altText: A composite image of a man and a woman at a train station.

props.synopsis: The pre-election trial will see all fares on the Translink network, regardless of the length of trip, cost a flat 50 cents on buses, trains, ferries, and trams.

title.children: Some commuters 'buzzing' as 50-cent public transport trial kicks off in Queensland

image.altText: Two people stand atop a rowboat celebrating.

props.synopsis: After 86 days of isolation on the water, Fanch Landron and his partner Sophie Bernier reach Reunion Island in their bright pink rowboat.

title.children: Couple navigate bad weather, sharks and isolation to complete epic row across Indian Ocean

image.altText: wind farm in paddocks

props.synopsis: As demand for electricity rises, energy companies are stepping in with plans to transform WA pastures into wind farms over the next decade prompting councils to ask for "serious" policies from the state government.

title.children: Farming heartland to become energy hub with more than 260 wind turbines
